markers.name: Thap A - Main Temple Complex
markers.description: The most significant and well-preserved temple group, featuring the main sanctuary dedicated to King Jaya Indravarman II. This complex showcases the finest examples of Cham architecture with intricate brick work and stone carvings.

markers.name: Thap H - Water Temple
markers.description: A unique water temple complex featuring ancient hydraulic systems and sacred pools. This site demonstrates the Cham people's advanced understanding of water management and its spiritual significance.

markers.name: Thap K - Royal Complex
markers.description: The royal temple complex that served as the spiritual center for Cham kings. Features elaborate stone sculptures and inscriptions that provide insights into ancient Cham royal ceremonies.
